alert.note: Alert for Hertford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 8:59PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Carolina, including the following county, Hertford. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through 10 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ahoskie, Winton, Cofield, Harrellsville, Brantleys Grove, Tunis, Oak Villa, Proctors Corner, Poor Town and Earleys. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
